column4: Space Exploration Technologies Corp. (SpaceX) is an American aerospace manufacturer space transportation services and communications company headquartered in Hawthorne California. SpaceX was founded in 2002 by Elon Musk with the goal of reducing space transportation costs to enable the colonization of Mars. SpaceX manufactures the Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy launch vehicles several rocket engines Dragon cargo crew spacecraft and Starlink communications satellites.

Facebook Inc. is an American multinational technology company based in Menlo Park California. It was founded in 2004 as TheFacebook by Mark Zuckerberg Eduardo Saverin Andrew McCollum Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Hughes roommates and students at Harvard College. The namesake social networking service eventually became Facebook and amassing 2.9 billion monthly users by 2021.

Tesla Inc. is an American electric vehicle and clean energy company based in Palo Alto California United States. Tesla designs and manufactures electric cars and battery energy storage from home to grid-scale and solar panels and solar roof tiles and related products and services. In 2020 and Tesla had the most sales of battery electric vehicles and plug-in electric vehicles and capturing 16% of the plug-in market (which includes plug-in hybrids) and 23% of the battery-electric (purely electric) market. Through its subsidiary Tesla Energy and the company develops and is a major installer of photovoltaic systems in the United States. Tesla Energy is also one of the largest global suppliers of battery energy storage systems and with 3 gigawatt-hours (GWh) installed in 2020.

Google LLC is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products and which include online advertising technologies and a search engine and cloud computing and software and hardware. It is considered one of the Big Five companies in the American information technology industry and along with Amazon and Facebook and Apple and Microsoft.

Neuralink Corporation is a neurotechnology company developing implantable brainâ€“machine interfaces (BMIs) and founded by Elon Musk and others. The company's headquarters is in the Pioneer Building in San Francisco sharing offices with OpenAI. Neuralink was launched in 2016 and was first publicly reported in March 2017.

Amazon.com Inc is an American multinational conglomerate which focuses on e-commerce and cloud computing and digital streaming and artificial intelligence. It is one of the Big Five companies in the U.S. information technology industry and along with Google and Apple and Microsoft and Facebook. The company has been referred to as "one of the most influential economic and cultural forces in the world" as well as the world's most valuable brand.

Alphabet Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate headquartered in Mountain View California. It was created through a restructuring of Google on October 2 in 2015 and became the parent company of Google and several former Google subsidiaries. The two co-founders of Google remained as controlling shareholders and board members and employees at Alphabet. Alphabet is the world's fourth-largest technology company by revenue and one of the world's most valuable companies.
